question: Virtual memory allows ____________
options: ['a) execution of a process that may not be completely in memory', 'b) a program to be smaller than the physical memory', 'c) a program to be larger than the secondary storage', 'd) execution of a process without being in physical memory']
option1: a) execution of a process that may not be completely in memory
option2: b) a program to be smaller than the physical memory
option3: c) a program to be larger than the secondary storage
option4: d) execution of a process without being in physical memory

question: The instruction being executed, must be in ____________
options: ['a) physical memory', 'b) logical memory', 'c) physical & logical memory', 'd) none of the mentioned']

question: Error handler codes, to handle
options: ['unusual', 'errors are ____________', 'a) almost never executed', 'b) executed very often']

question: The ability to execute a program that is only partially in memory has benefits like ____________
options: ['a) The amount of physical memory cannot put a constraint on the program', 'b) Programs for an extremely large virtual space can be created', 'c) Throughput increases', 'd) All of the mentioned']
option1: a) The amount of physical memory cannot put a constraint on the program
option2: b) Programs for an extremely large virtual space can be created

question: In virtual memory
options: ['a) has to take care', 'b) does not have to take care', 'c) all of the mentioned', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option2: b) does not have to take care

question: Virtual memory is normally implemented by ________
options: ['a) demand paging', 'b) buses', 'c) virtualization', 'd) all of the mentioned']

question: Segment replacement algorithms are more complex than page replacement algorithms because ____________
options: ['a) Segments are better than pages', 'b) Pages are better than segments', 'c) Segments have variable sizes', 'd) Segments have fixed sizes']
option1: a) Segments are better than pages
option2: b) Pages are better than segments

question: A swapper manipulates ___________ whereas the pager is concerned with individual _______ of a process
options: ['a) the entire process, parts', 'b) all the pages of a process, segments', 'c) the entire process, pages', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option2: b) all the pages of a process, segments

question: Using a pager ____________
options: ['a) increases the swap time', 'b) decreases the swap time', 'c) decreases the swap time & amount of physical memory needed', 'd) increases the amount of physical memory needed']
option3: c) decreases the swap time & amount of physical memory needed
option4: d) increases the amount of physical memory needed

question: The valid – invalid bit, in this case, when valid indicates?
options: ['a) the page is not legal', 'b) the page is illegal', 'c) the page is in memory', 'd) the page is not in memory']
option1: a) the page is not legal
option3: c) the page is in memory
option4: d) the page is not in memory

question: A page fault occurs when?
options: ['a) a page gives inconsistent data', 'b) a page cannot be accessed due to its absence from memory', 'c) a page is invisible', 'd) all of the mentioned']
option1: a) a page gives inconsistent data
option2: b) a page cannot be accessed due to its absence from memory

question: When a page fault occurs, the state of the interrupted process is ____________
options: ['a) disrupted', 'b) invalid', 'c) saved', 'd) none of the mentioned']

question: When a process begins execution with no pages in memory?
options: ['a) process execution becomes impossible', 'b) a page fault occurs for every page brought into memory', 'c) process causes system crash', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option2: b) a page fault occurs for every page brought into memory

question: If the memory access time is denoted by ‘ma’ and ‘p’ is the probability of a page fault (0 <= p <= 1)
options: ['a) p x ma + (1-p) x page fault time', 'b) ma + page fault time', 'c) (1-p) x ma + p x page fault time', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) p x ma + (1-p) x page fault time
option3: c) (1-p) x ma + p x page fault time

question: When the page fault rate is low ____________
options: ['a) the turnaround time increases', 'b) the effective access time increases', 'c) the effective access time decreases', 'd) turnaround time & effective access time increases']
option2: b) the effective access time increases
option3: c) the effective access time decreases
option4: d) turnaround time & effective access time increases

question: Locality of reference implies that the page reference being made by a process ____________
options: ['a) will always be to the page used in the previous page reference', 'b) is likely to be one of the pages used in the last few page references', 'c) will always be one of the pages existing in memory', 'd) will always lead to page faults']
option1: a) will always be to the page used in the previous page reference
option2: b) is likely to be one of the pages used in the last few page references
option3: c) will always be one of the pages existing in memory
option4: d) will always lead to page faults
